message: I'm curious if any Ubuntu users out there have strong feelings regarding Unity. I'm still undecided. Sometimes it's handy but other times I get the feeling that the normal menus are just a lot easier. I think it'll take a bit more use before I can really decide how I feel.
I think it is the worst user interface I have ever used. I gave it a chance, too. I used it on my netbook for about a month. I switched back to Gnome.

I think my biggest gripe so far is that it's difficult to find the items which normally live under the System menu. I normally use Alt + F2 to launch my day-to-day software. If I don't remember the name of something I only occasionally use from the System menu to type it, though, looking through the whole list of installed applications can be irritating.

I actually just installed Fedora 15 on another laptop and I have to say that despite seeming similar from screenshots, Gnome 3 is leaps and bounds better than Unity. Overall it just runs much more smoothly and is far easier to use. Whereas in Ubuntu I went back to running some older version of Gnome, I can see myself being happy with the default Fedora setup.
@JohnFail but the Fedora package manager is the slowest I've ever tried.
@fredovich Do you mean Yum? Cause I find this very fast.
Maybe, but pacman from Arch is the fastest. I think Im more familiarized with it..
